00019 namespace Util
00020 {
00021 
00022    // Define the Zero Vector
00023    const Vector Vector::Zero = Vector(0.0);
00024 
00025    // Equality operators
00026    
00027    #define EPSILON 1.0E-8
00028    
00029    bool operator==(const Vector& v1, const Vector& v2) 
00030    {
00031       for (int i=0; i < Dimension; ++i) {
00032          if ( fabs(v1.elem_[i] - v2.elem_[i]) > EPSILON) {
00033             return false;
00034          }
00035       }
00036       return true;
00037    }
00038    
00039    bool operator==(const Vector& v1, const double* v2) 
00040    {
00041       for (int i=0; i < Dimension; ++i) {
00042          if ( fabs(v1.elem_[i] - v2[i]) > EPSILON) {
00043             return false;
00044          }
00045       }
00046       return true;
00047    }
00048    
00049    #undef EPSILON
00050    
00051    bool operator==(const double* v1, const Vector& v2) 
00052    { return (v2 == v1); }
00053    
00054    // Inequality operators
00055    
00056    bool operator!=(const Vector& v1, const Vector& v2) 
00057    { return !(v1 == v2); }
00058    
00059    bool operator!=(const Vector& v1, const double* v2) 
00060    { return !(v1 == v2); }
00061    
00062    bool operator!=(const double* v1, const Vector& v2) 
00063    { return !(v2 == v1); }
00064    
00065    /* 
00066    * Extract a Vector from an istream.
00067    */
00068    std::istream& operator>>(std::istream& in, Vector &vector)
00069    {
00070       for (int i=0; i < Dimension; ++i) {
00071          in >> vector.elem_[i];
00072       }
00073       return in;
00074    }
00075    
00076    /* 
00077    * Output a Vector to an ostream, without line breaks.
00078    */
00079    std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& out, const Vector &vector) 
00080    {
00081       for (int i=0; i < Dimension; ++i) {
00082          out.setf(std::ios::scientific);
00083          out.width(Vector::Width);
00084          out.precision(Vector::Precision);
00085          out << vector.elem_[i];
00086       }
00087       return out;
00088    }
00089 
00090    #ifdef UTIL_MPI
00091 
00094    MPI::Datatype MpiTraits<Vector>::type = MPI::BYTE;
00095    bool MpiTraits<Vector>::hasType = false;
00096 
00100    void Vector::commitMpiType() 
00101    {
00102       if (!MpiTraits<Vector>::hasType) {
00103          MpiStructBuilder builder;
00104          Vector           vector;
00105    
00106          builder.setBase(&vector);
00107          builder.addMember(&vector[0], MPI::DOUBLE);
00108          builder.addMember(&vector[1], MPI::DOUBLE);
00109          builder.addMember(&vector[2], MPI::DOUBLE);
00110          builder.commit(MpiTraits<Vector>::type);
00111          MpiTraits<Vector>::hasType = true;
00112       }
00113    }
00114    #endif
00115 
00116    /*
00117    * This static method exists to guarantee initialization of the static 
00118    * constant Vector::Zero that is defined in this file.  Call it once
00119    * in the program to guarantee that the contents of this file will 
00120    * be linked, rather than optimized away. 
00121    */
00122    void Vector::initStatic()
00123    {
00124       static int nCall = 0;
00125       ++nCall;
00126    }

00128 }
